Package me.marcosassuncao.servsim.server

Class DefaultResourcePool

java.lang.Object
me.marcosassuncao.servsim.SimEntity
me.marcosassuncao.servsim.server.ResourcePool
me.marcosassuncao.servsim.server.DefaultResourcePool
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventSink<SimEvent>
public class DefaultResourcePool extends ResourcePool
This class represents a pool of resources. This class implements a delegation of SingleProfile.
Author:
Marcos Dias de Assuncao

  • Method Details

    • checkAvailability

      public ProfileEntry checkAvailability(long time)
      Returns a profile entry with the currently available resources.
      Specified by:
      checkAvailability in class ResourcePool
      Parameters:
      time - the time from which the availability is checked
      Returns:
      a ProfileEntry with ranges available at the given time.

    • checkAvailability

      public ProfileEntry checkAvailability(int reqRes, long startTime, long duration)
      Returns a profile entry if a given job with the characteristics provided can be scheduled.
      Specified by:
      checkAvailability in class ResourcePool
      Parameters:
      reqRes - the number of resources.
      startTime - the start time of the job/reservation
      duration - the duration of the job/reservation
      Returns:
      a ProfileEntry with the start time provided and the ranges available at that time OR null if not enough resources are found.

    • checkAvailability

      public ProfileEntry checkAvailability(int reqRes, long startTime, long duration, boolean acceptLessResources)
      Returns a profile entry if a given job with the characteristics provided can be scheduled.
      Specified by:
      checkAvailability in class ResourcePool
      Parameters:
      reqRes - the number of resources.
      startTime - the start time of the job/reservation
      duration - the duration of the job/reservation
      acceptLessResources - defines whether less resources than originally requested is allowed
      Returns:
      a ProfileEntry with the start time provided and the ranges available at that time OR null if not enough resources are found.

    • findStartTime

      public ProfileEntry findStartTime(int reqRes, long duration)
      Selects an entry able to provide enough resources to handle a job. The method iterates the profile until it finds enough resources for the job, starting from the current simulation time.
      Specified by:
      findStartTime in class ResourcePool
      Parameters:
      reqRes - the number of resources
      duration - the duration in seconds to execute the job
      Returns:
      an ProfileEntry with the time at which the job can start and the ranges available at that time.

    • findStartTime

      public ProfileEntry findStartTime(int reqRes, long readyTime, long duration)
      Selects an entry able to provide enough resources to handle a job. The method iterates the profile until it finds enough resources for the job, starting from the current simulation time.
      Parameters:
      reqRes - the number of resources
      readyTime - the time before which a request cannot be scheduled
      duration - the duration in seconds to execute the job
      Returns:
      an ProfileEntry with the time at which the job can start and the ranges available at that time.

    • allocateResources

      Allocates a list of resource ranges to a job/reservation.
      Specified by:
      allocateResources in class ResourcePool
      Parameters:
      task - the work unit for which resources need to be allocated
      selected - the list of resource ranges selected
      startTime - the start time of the job/reservation

      Parameters:

      startTime - the start time of the job/reservation

    • releaseResources

      public boolean releaseResources(long startTime, long finishTime, RangeList list)
      Includes a time slot in this availability profile. This is useful if your scheduling strategy cancels a job and you want to update the availability profile.
      Specified by:
      releaseResources in class ResourcePool
      Parameters:
      startTime - the start time of the time slot.
      finishTime - the finish time of the time slot.
      list - the list of ranges of resources in the slot.
      Returns:
      true if the slot was included; false otherwise.

    • getNumberFreeUnits

      public long getNumberFreeUnits(long startTime, long endTime)
      Returns the number of simulation units over which resources have been free. This is useful for computing resource utilisation.
      Parameters:
      startTime - start time to consider when computing the units
      endTime - end time to consider when computing the units
      Returns:
      the number of free resource units

    • getNumberUsedUnits

      public long getNumberUsedUnits(long startTime, long endTime)
      Returns the number of simulation units over which resources have been used. This is useful for computing resource utilisation.
      Parameters:
      startTime - start time to consider when computing the units
      endTime - end time to consider when computing the units
      Returns:
      the number of used resource units

    • getUtilization

      public double getUtilization(long startTime, long endTime)
      Returns the resource utilisation during a given period.
      Specified by:
      getUtilization in class ResourcePool
      Parameters:
      startTime - the initial time
      endTime - the finish time
      Returns:
      the resource utilisation between 0.0 and 1.0

      Returns:
